@apaszke I believe many are useful. @zou3519 is implementing digamma in #3955 . Other functions would be nice, e.g.:

  • incomplete Gamma and Beta functions to compute CDFs
  • trigamma to compute gradients of entropy of Gamma and Beta distributions (since entropy involves a digamma)
  • @martinjankowiak and I may be able to use the hypergeometric implementation from Cephes to replace the relatively low-precision implementations of standard_gamma_grad() and dirichlet_grad().
  • I'm sure there will be more use cases in the future 😄

@zou3519 since you're requesting author's permission to use digamma could you broaden the request to all of Cephes in case we want to use other functions? I may try to follow your digamma pr to also include trigamma.
